org.transitime.ipc.interfaces

Interface ConfigInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigServer

    public interface ConfigInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Defines the RMI interface for getting configuration data.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Returns list of block IDs, unsorted, duplicates removed

      Returns blocks for each service class for the blockId specified.

      Returns list of Calendar objects that are currently active.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoutes

        java.util.Collection<IpcRouteSummary> getRoutes()
                                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Obtains ordered list of routes configured.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getRoute

        IpcRoute getRoute(java.lang.String routeIdOrShortName,
                  java.lang.String directionId,
                  java.lang.String stopId,
                  java.lang.String tripPatternId)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Obtains data for single route.
        Parameters:
        routeIdOrShortName - Specifies which route to provide data for. routeShortName is often used instead of routeId since routeIds unfortunately often change when there is a schedule change.
        directionId - optional. If want UI to highlight the remaining stops and paths left in the trip then can specify directionId along with the stopId. The directionId can be needed for agencies where only a single stop is used for both directions for a route.
        stopId - optional. If want UI to highlight the remaining stops and paths left in trip then stopId is used to return which stops remain in trip. If this additional info not needed for UI then null can be specified.
        tripPatternId - optional. If want UI to highlight the remaining stops and paths left in trip then stopId is used to determine which trip pattern to highlight. If this additional info not needed for UI then null can be specified.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getStops

        IpcDirectionsForRoute getStops(java.lang.String routeIdOrShortName)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns stops for each direction for a route.
        Parameters:
        routeIdOrShortName - Specifies which route to provide data for. routeShortName is often used instead of routeId since routeIds unfortunately often change when there is a schedule change.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getBlock

        IpcBlock getBlock(java.lang.String blockId,
                  java.lang.String serviceId)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns block info for specified blockId and serviceId. Includes all trip and trip pattern info associated with the block.
        Parameters:
        blockId -
        serviceId -

        Throws:
